source.name: 2.3 Test Your Knowledge - Rasa Custom Actions
source.instructions: **In a Rasa custom action, which of the following correctly sends a message to the user?**

answers.answer:
```python-hide-clipboard
dispatcher.utter_message(text="Hello, how can I help you?")
```

```python-hide-clipboard
tracker.send_message(text="Hello, how can I help you?")
```

```python-hide-clipboard
domain.utter_message(text="Hello, how can I help you?")
```

```python-hide-clipboard
self.send_message(text="Hello, how can I help you?")
```

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify the correct way to send messages in Rasa custom actions
source.guidance: The correct answer is `dispatcher.utter_message(text="Hello, how can I help you?")`. The `dispatcher` parameter in a Rasa custom action is specifically responsible for sending messages to the user. The `tracker` is for accessing conversation state and slot values, while the `domain` contains configuration information. The method `utter_message()` belongs to the dispatcher object, not to the other components.
